Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Scarab
Description: The back of the scarab is smooth. On the reverse, a carved motif represents the falcon-headed god Horus kneeling on a neb sign ("lord, all, every"), together with a crocodile. The scarab is pierced longitudinally, thus allowing for it to be suspended.
